definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Too much money causes some people to become snobbish.
sentences.chinese: 太多钱使有些人变成势利眼。

sentences.english: One shouldn't be too snobbish, as snobs are hated by all people.
sentences.chinese: 做人不能太势利眼了，嫌贫爱富的人让人痛恨。

sentences.english: Constance: Me? I haven't a snobbish bone in my body.
sentences.chinese: 我？我身体里没有一根势利眼的骨头。

sentences.english: If they didn't like the ex because (they thought)she was a snob, be humble.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们觉得她势利眼，你就要表现得谦虚。

sentences.english: He is nothing but a snob.
There is certainly not much social snobbery or job snobbery.
sentences.chinese: 的确，美国人对社会地位或不同工作没有什么势利眼。

sentences.english: Had she met him under normal circumstances, he might never have known what an appalling snob she really was.
sentences.chinese: 或许永远不会知道她真的是太势利眼了。

sentences.english: They are snobs. That is why they look down upon us.
sentences.chinese: 他们是势利眼，这就是他们看不起我们的原因。

sentences.english: I am sick of his snobbery.

definition: to favor the rich and disdain the poor (idiom)/snobbish
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
